CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function _wrapMatchesInNode is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is because it uses the innerHTML property to insert user-controlled data into the DOM. If the data passed to the _convertUrlsToLinks function contains any malicious scripts, they will be executed when the data is inserted into the DOM. This can lead to a variety of attacks, such as stealing sensitive information or performing actions on behalf of the user.
